fixes.name: BATCH
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR numerator = 'migration_Extract_POC (1) (local copy)'[Initial Cash USD T (excl Int/FWD) Abs]
VAR total = CALCULATE(
    'migration_Extract_POC (1) (local copy)'[Initial Cash USD T (excl Int/FWD) Abs],
    ALL('migration_Extract_POC (1) (local copy)')
)
RETURN DIVIDE(numerator, total)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the Tableau expression [Initial Cash USD T (excl Int/FWD) Abs] / TOTAL([Initial Cash USD T (excl Int/FWD) Abs]) to DAX. The numerator references the calculated field on the same table. The TOTAL(...) table calculation is represented by CALCULATE(..., ALL(table)) to get the overall total; DIVIDE is used to handle division safely.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The Tableau formula uses the table calculation TOTAL(...) (an aggregation across the table) and references an aggregated calculated field, therefore it must be implemented as a measure.
